Solution: 
Since $x+y\neq -1$, we can solve the system by Cramer's rule. 

\begin{align*}
a&=\frac{|x+7\ y\ 1|}{|x+y\ y\ 1|}=\frac{x+7}{2},\\
b&=\frac{|x\ y+6\ y\ 1|}{|x+y\ y\ 1|}=\frac{2x+6y}{2}=x+3y,\\
c&=\frac{|x\ y\ 2x+6y\ 1|}{|x+y\ y\ 1|}=\frac{4x+y}{2}=2x+\frac{1}{2}y.
\end{align*}

Therefore, \begin{align*}
a+b+c&=\frac{x+7}{2}+(x+3y)+(2x+\frac{1}{2}y)\\
&=\frac{x+7}{2}+x+\frac{7}{2}y\\
&=\boxed{\frac{3}{2}x+\frac{1}{2}y+\frac{7}{2}}.
\end{align*}
Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{3}{2}x+\frac{1}{2}y+\frac{7}{2}}.$ I hope it is correct.
